section.title: Time Based Releases
section.para: The release cycle works around a rough 6 month timeline
This time period was chosen because it corresponds to the release cycle length of Gnome and major linux distributions such as Fedora and Ubuntu.
This should mean that each new release can get a greater amount of testing.
There are two phases of a release, the development period and the testing period.
All code committed during the development period must exist and be accessible for review before the development period starts.
All code committed during the development period must be reviewed and approved by the lead developers before the period starts.
New library dependencies can only be introduced during development period and must be approved by platform maintainers.
